author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...FLASH FLOODING AND A RISK OF TORNADOES REMAIN POSSIBLE ALONG PATH OF POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE BERYL THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
summary:
...FLASH FLOODING AND A RISK OF TORNADOES REMAIN POSSIBLE ALONG PATH OF POST-TROPICAL CYCLONE BERYL THROUGH WEDNESDAY...
 As of 4:00 PM CDT Tue Jul 9
 the center of Beryl was located near 37.8, -89.5
 with movement NE at 24 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 1005 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 30 mph.

title: Summary - Post-Tropical Cyclone Beryl (AT2/AL022024)
